moves.1. d4: Great, QP openings.  I decided to try a Kings Indian, just to see how it went.
moves.1... Nf6 2. Nf3 g6: Looking it up later, I should have tried a Queen's Indian instead (it becomes apparent during the game too, the black bishop is practically useless)
moves.3. Bf4 Bg7 4. Nbd2 O-O 5. h3 e6 6. c4 d5: Fighting for the center just a bit
moves.7. e3 Nbd7 8. Bd3 c5: I'm not sure if that was a good idea, but it looked ok at the time.
moves.9. O-O b6: This cuts off mobility for my knight.  Probably a bad idea.
I stared at the board for a whole 2 minutes before making this move.   I missed his response completely.  I was extremely disappointed in myself.  I should have simply traded knights with him.  It would have slightly  decreased his presence in the center.
Attacking, but weakening his kingside.  My queens diagonal is now open.  I attempt to move quickly to exploit.
moves.20... Nf4 21. Re3 Qh4 22. Qb3 Nxg4: I was fairly proud of this move at the time.  If he had done 23. hxg4 then 23...Qh1#.  Again, GameKnot spoils me and I didn't look very far down the line at his counter moves.
moves.23. Nxe6+ fxe6 24. Rg3 Nxh3: I was starting to get low on time.  I did this simply because I thought it could lead to something.  I was wrong.
moves.26. Rxh7 Kg8 27. Rh3 Rf8 28. cxb6 axb6 2: And my clock ran out.  For being an opening that I wasn't familiar with, I felt ok about it, if not just a little disappointed.

gameName: First game vs els_dogger on yahoo
